OVERESTIMATE.Definition: think that something is better than it really is

OVERTHROWING.Definition: removing someone from power using force

RULING CLASS.Definition: the social class that is in power

GRADUAL.Definition: happening slowly over a period of time

OVERTHROW.Definition: removal of someone from power using force

TERM.Definition: a word used to describe something

IRREVERSIBLY.Definition: in a way that it cannot be changed back to the way it was

MASS.Definition: involving a very large number of people

MIGRATION.Definition: movement from one place to another in order to find work or have better life conditions

MINES.Definition: a tunnel dug in the earth in order to obtain minerals, usually coal

COTTON.Definition: a soft white material used for making clothes

STEAM.Definition: the invisible form the water takes after being boiled

ENGINE.Definition: a machine that uses the energy from steam to produce movement

ACHIEVE.Definition: succeed in doing something or causing it to happen

TEXTILE.Definition: a type of cloth or fabric

TRIAL AND ERROR.Definition: a way of doing things by trying and learning from the mistakes made

CREDITED.Definition: publicly recognised as having achieved something

OXEN.Definition: plural of ox (a type of bull)

PLOUGHS.Definition: big farming tools that dig the soil in fields so that seeds can be planted

LEAP.Definition: large jump, meaning a big increase

STEAM-POWERED.Definition: powered by an engine that uses steam

CANALS.Definition: a constructed waterway made to allow the passage of boats inland

CROPS.Definition: plants grown in large amounts by people

PHENOMENON.Definition: a fact that exists and can be seen

REVERT.Definition: return (to a previous state, way etc.)

CATASTROPHE.Definition: a sudden event that causes very great trouble

CROP.Definition: plants grown in large amounts by people

INFANT MORTALITY.Definition: the death of babies, especially before their first birthday

COAL MINES.Definition: tunnels dug in the earth in order to collect coal

CRITICISMS.Definition: the acts of saying that something is wrong

CHILD LABOUR.Definition: the use of children to do work that should be done by adults

HIDEOUSLY.Definition: in an unacceptable and very ugly way

UNSKILLED.Definition: not requiring special skill or training

INFANTHOOD.Definition: the period of time when someone is a very young child

REPAIR.Definition: to turn a bad condition of something to a good, working one

EARNINGS.Definition: the amount of money that someone earns from working

FACTOR.Definition: something that affects the result of something

COAL.Definition: a hard, black material that is dug from the earth and can be burned to produce heat or power

RELATIVE.Definition: in comparison to the previous situation

ENTREPRENEURIAL.Definition: characterised by the taking of financial risks hoping to gain profit

ENTREPRENEURS.Definition: people who take financial risks hoping to gain profit

INTERFERE.Definition: take part in the concerns or business of someone

STANDARDISED.Definition: made standard, regular and with the same features

IRREVERSIBLE.Definition: not possible to change back to the way it was

WAGE.Definition: an amount of money that is paid regularly as payment for a work being done

STANDARDISATION.Definition: the process of making something have the same features

BLOCKCHAIN.Definition: a system of storing records of transactions using digital currencies in a computer network

EXTENT.Definition: length, amount (meaning how important it will be)

REDUNDANT.Definition: unnecessary because they are not needed anymore
